summary: This is an email exchange regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, involving an FBI agent from the Violent Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking Task Force and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York. The email discusses scheduling a call to discuss trial logistics.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, requests a call to discuss logistics for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Email regarding Maxwell trial logistics
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails an FBI agent to schedule a call to discuss logistics for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email is dated November 6, 2021, during the period of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
The communication is between a federal prosecutor and an FBI agent from the Violent Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking Task Force.
The subject is logistical planning for the Maxwell trial.
The prosecutor's office is identified as the Southern District of New York, located at One Saint Andrew's Plaza in New York City.
